message.entry: {0} with 0 labels. Use the {1} method to add a label.

\n\t{0} with {1} sublabels and {2} attributes and belongs to {3} group.
\n\nFor more details about attributes and sublabels, use the {0} method.
Sublabels or Attributes
Invalid input for labelDefinitionCreator.
''{0}'' is not a valid name. It must be a valid MATLAB variable name.
''{0}'' already exists in the definitions. Choose another unique name.
{0} ''{1}'' does not exist.
''{0}'' does not exist. Add it using the addLabel method first, and then add {1}.
PixelLabels, Scene, and Custom labels cannot have {0}. Only Rectangles and Lines currently support {0}.
PixelLabels, PointLabels, Scene, and Custom labels cannot be Sublabels. Only Rectangles or Lines are allowed.
''{0}'' has already been defined as a {1} under ''{2}''. Consider removing it, and re-creating it to edit.
''{0}'' does not exist in the hierarchy of ''{1}'' in the label definition.
Label name specification needs to be of the form ''labelname/sublabelname'' or ''labelname'' only.
Specified label name must be a character vector or string scalar.
{0} cannot be defined before defining a label. Define a label first, and then create {1}.
{0}/{1} can only be used to reference the sublabel, and not to create it.
''{0}'' has not been defined in the hierarchy under ''{1}''. Define the sublabel first, and then add attributes to it.
Pixel Label IDs cannot be greater than {0}.
Inputs specified for List Attributes are invalid. It must be a cell array of strings or character vectors.
Yellow (RGB = [1 1 0]) is reserved for the color of selected labels.
